subject: Leadership
title: Negotiation Essentials
description: A quick, practical guide to Negotiation Essentials.

hook.text: Two sisters fight over one orange. Mom cuts it in half. One needed the juice, the other the peel. Both lose.

buildup.text: Most negotiations fail because people argue positions, not interests. Positions are demands. Interests are the why.

discovery.text: Fisher and Ury's 'Getting to Yes': separate people from problems, focus on interests, generate options for mutual gain.

twist.text: The best negotiators don't win by taking more. They expand the pie so everyone walks away with more than expected.

climax.text: Before any negotiation, list your interests and theirs. Find where they overlap. That overlap is where deals live.

punchline.text: The best deal is one both sides brag about.

quiz.question: What is the key insight from 'Getting to Yes'?
options: Always start with a high demand
